revised_title: Vertebral Characters of Pterosauria: Pterodactylus and Dimorphodon
tldr: The author examines the vertebral characters of the Pterosauria, specifically Pterodactylus and Dimorphodon, and discovers that their cervical and dorso-lumbar vertebrae exhibit the earliest known instance of the "procoelian" type, which is now prevalent in the reptilian class. This finding provides new insights into the evolution and classification of these ancient flying reptiles.
